decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to control the board and the opponent's resources while generating value from cards like Waste Not and Mazemind Tome. With a mix of creatures and planeswalkers, the deck can apply pressure while maintaining control of the game. The land base includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Castle Locthwain to provide additional advantage. Ultimately, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and win through attrition.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with Rakdos colors, utilizing cards that can quickly build up pressure on opponents and deal damage efficiently. It includes strong creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodtithe Harvester, removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt opponents' strategies, and key support cards like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord for additional creature buffs. The mana base is carefully chosen to ensure consistency and efficiency in casting spells, with cards like Mutavault and Blackcleave Cliffs providing the necessary resources for aggressive plays.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and apply pressure on the opponent. It includes a mix of aggressive creatures and spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes cards like Treasure Cruise and Consider to draw into more spells and keep the pressure on. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to efficiently cycle through spells while utilizing Arclight Phoenix as a powerful recurring threat.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of small, aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By leveraging cards like Adeline, Resplendent Cathar and Thalia's Lieutenant, as well as using protection spells like Brave the Elements and Dauntless Bodyguard, the deck aims to maintain board presence and deal consistent damage. Mutavault and Eiganjo, Seat of the Empire provide additional utility and resilience, while Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupts the opponent's game plan. The strategy revolves around quickly building a wide board and using synergy between creatures to push through damage and control the game.

This deck focuses on using Amalia Benavides Aguirre and various other creatures to generate life and trigger abilities that can lead to a massive life gain combo with Aetherflux Reservoir. The deck includes cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to find key pieces, as well as cards like Fauna Shaman and Selfless Savior to protect the combo. The mana base includes lands like Godless Shrine and Temple Garden to support the deck's colors, while also including cards like Blooming Marsh and Razorverge Thicket for additional mana fixing.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on establishing early board presence with low-cost creatures like Mausoleum Wanderer and Spectral Sailor, and using disruptive spells like Spell Queller and Spell Pierce to control the game. Wedding Announcement provides additional creatures and No More Lies helps protect them. Supreme Phantom buffs all your spirits while The Wandering Emperor supports them with its ability. The deck also includes lands that can produce multiple colors of mana to ensure you can cast your spells efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats on the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Extinction Event. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and resources through cards like Waste Not and Cling to Dust, allowing the player to outvalue their opponent over time. Finally, the deck has a strong finisher in Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, which can dominate the late game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

This deck focuses on quickly getting artifacts on the battlefield and using them aggressively to deal damage to the opponent. Cards like Ensoul Artifact and Smuggler's Copter can turn any artifact into a threat, while cards like Shrapnel Blast and Gleeful Demolition provide direct damage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion allows for additional flexibility in mana costs. With a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents early in the game with a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly to play powerful creatures and spells that work together to create a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The deck utilizes the Discover mechanic to find key cards and combos to further enhance its strategy. By using a diverse range of lands and spells, the deck aims to create a versatile and adaptive playstyle that can quickly shift gears to take control of the game.
